title: ‘Bullied’ ex-employee sues Lorna Jane
text:
Lorna Jane sportswear former employee Amy Robinson suing company for $550,000 Melanie Petrinec, The Courier-Mail February 14, 2017 1:21pm 
A FORMER Lorna Jane worker who is suing the active wear giant over alleged bullying and fat shaming has arrived at the Brisbane District Court ahead of a trial today. 
Amy Robinson is claiming almost $550,000 in damages over allegations her manager triggered a mental disorder when she worked for the company between July 16, 2012 and December 3, 2012. media_camera Amy Robinson (right), arrives at court for a trial with Lorna Jane about bullying in the workplace. Picture: Steve Pohlner 
The trial has been set down for four days and her solicitor, Kimberly Allen of Shine Lawyers, gave a brief statement outside court to say Ms Robinson was sticking up for everyone’s workplace rights. 
“What happened to Amy is quite simply unacceptable,” Ms Allen said. 
“Bullying and harassment, understaffing and poor working conditions are neither reasonable or appropriate in any workplace.” 
Lorna Jane has disputed Ms Robinson’s claims.
